tns:item.tns:title: PRJ#11140 - Drummond St WW Raplacement
tns:item.tns:address: Drummond St from Milton St to Cul-de-sac
tns:item.tns:publicDescription: Works will begin at the intersection of Drummond St and Milton Rd. A one way system, with traffic running east, will be implemented for up to 4 nights for the start of the waste water main replacement into Drummond St and the removal of a redundant manhole. An existing bus stop at the intersection will be relocated to another stop just east of the Colombo/Huxley intersection. Daytime aftercare TTM may be needed, using secured steel plates with centre of road and contra flow closures deployed during the day until this initial stage of construction will be completed. (TMP 2, 2a,3, SC021 & 031) The remainder of construction works in Drummond St will be completed under a road closure, which will be implemented daily between 7:30am and 6:00pm. Residents will be notified that access may be restricted between these hours. Secured steel plates will be used outside of these hours to allow residents access. (TMP 1)

tns:item.tns:description: Drummond St from Milton St to Cul-de-sac

tns:item.tns:title: SCIRT Waste Water Relay and Road Reconstructi
tns:item.tns:address: Aranui Catchment: Breezes Rd, Shortland St, Lenton St, Tomrich St, Rowses Rd, Merrington Cres, Betty Pl, Doreen St and Marlow Rd
tns:item.tns:publicDescription: Installation of a new vacuum sewer system in parallel to keeping the existing system in operation. This involves installation of collection Chambers ? in council land, vent stacks on private boundaries and the install of new vacuum mains. Final hook up to the new system will happen only when the vacuum pump station is built and commissioned. The pump station is due for completion in Early 2016 and is being done by other parties outside this contract. Due to the ground conditions and high water table this area went through a rigorous design process comparing it to Pressure WW and Vacuum WW. Road Reconstruction will then take place through out the whole catchment using the same setups and Road Closures

tns:item.tns:title: PRJ#11163 - 97M Cashmere Rd SW Repair
tns:item.tns:address: Cashmere Rd re between Fairview St and Begal Dr
tns:item.tns:publicDescription: Work will begin with the removal of the small wooden fencing and paving of the berm between the footpath and carriage way, to allow for the removal of the pedestrian islands. (TMP 3) The next stage will be the works will be the removal of the island closest to the river, which will then be paved and made trafficable. (TMP 1) Following that, east bound traffic will be redirected on the newly paved area, and the removal of the central raised island will be completed, and will also be paved and made trafficable. (TMP 2) Excavations for the repair to the storm water main will now begin on the southern kerb of Cashmere Rd. (TMP 4) Repairs will continue to a point where there is enough space to accommodate two traffic lanes, at which stage, the repaired section will be backfilled and resurfaced, and traffic will be diverted towards the southern kerb, with works continuing towards the northern kerb, ending inside the grass berm (TMP 5) All works will be under a 30km/h TSL with cyclist merging. Works are expected to take up to 2 weeks to complete.

tns:item.tns:title: PRJ#11133 - Brougham St WW Lateral Repairs
tns:item.tns:address: Brougham St from Barrington St to Barrie St
tns:item.tns:publicDescription: Works will begin with the repairs around the intersection of Brougham St and Spencer St. This section of works are expected to take approximately 7 nights to complete (TMP 1 ? 1a) The next section of repairs will be in lane 2 of both the east and west bound lanes of Brougham St, east of Selwyn St. This section of works is expected to take approximately 7 nights to complete (TMP 2 ? 2a) The final section of works will be closures of lane 1 for both east and west bound traffic of Brougham St. This section of works will take approximately 7 nights to complete. Excavations in this section of works are expected to be in close proximity to the live lane. As an extra safety precaution, the TMA will be used to shadow all works as they move closer to the live lane. (TMP 3 -3a) All excavations will be hydro excavated to expose the damaged section of pipe. Repairs will be carried out, reinstated to road level, and sealed. All construction materials, plant and TTM equipment will be removed daily at the end of works every morning. All TTM will be deployed and removed with the use of the Generic Moblie closure diagram (SC 205)

tns:item.tns:title: PRJ#10585 - Shirley Manhole Decommissioning
tns:item.tns:address: Various locations within the Shirley suburb
tns:item.tns:publicDescription: Works will begin on the eastern side of Shirley (Sutton Place Cheam St, Mundys Ave) using generic plans and move westward on the LV/L1 roads, until reaching Hope St, at which point works will commence on L2 roads. (TMP 1) Due to narrow carriage ways, several locations will require site specific TMPs. (TMP 2, 3, 4) All works will require the excavation of 400mm from road level, then the redundant manholes will be then filled with appropriate materials, and then built up to road surface level, and sealed. Works may take up to 3 days. This will be dependent on the depth and width of the manhole and also on the availability of the appropriate backfill material.

tns:item.tns:title: PRJ11115 - Ferry Rd Brick Barrel SW
tns:item.tns:address: Ferry Rd between Ryan St and #537 Ferry Rd
tns:item.tns:publicDescription: Works will begin at the intersection pedestrian crossing east of the intersection of Ferry Rd and Hopkins St. The raised island on the north side of the crossing will be removed so that two-way traffic can safely be maintained while the repair works are carried out. Works will be carried out under a contra flow, with MTC as a contingency at night if the work area needs to be increased. Pedestrians will be directed to the pedestrian crossing at the intersection of Ferry Rd and Smith St. Once the island has been removed, temporary pavement will be laid up to level with the existing road. (TMP 1, SC Generics) Construction works are in the intersection of Ferry Rd and Hopkins St. Two-way traffic will be maintained along with a north bound one way system on Hopkins St. Initial works will be a shallow excavation for the installation of sheet piling for the trench. Excavations will proceed to the required depth, repairs will be undertaken, backfill of excavation, removal of sheet piling, then reinstatement of surface up to road level. Throughout works pedestrians will be redirected to alternate crossing at Ferry Rd/ Smith St. As these works are in close proximity to a school, a contingency plan for MTC before and after school hours may be implemented to facilitate the safe travel of children to and from school. (TMP 2, 2a,3,SC Generics) Once construction works have been completed, work site will revert back for the reinstatement of the raised island, and reopening of the pedestrian crossing (TMP1, SC Generics) This section repair is expected to take 25 days to complete. The next repair will be at the intersection of Ferry Rd and Isabella St. The first stage of these works will be the removal of a 20m section of the raised island separating east and west bound traffic. A centre of road closure with TSL will be implemented and removal works will take place at night, with partial closure of the east bound right turning lane on Ferry Rd. Due to the location of works, the removal of this section of the island is required so that west bound traffic can be directed in to the east bound right turning lane, as the east lane bound lane will be too narrow due to the work area. (TMP 4a, 4b) Due to the close proximity of works to the Ensors Rd intersection, a shorter taper and longitudinal safety zone will need to be installed. Water fill barriers will be used to reduce the risk of traffic entering the work area. Site access will require vehicles to enter at the sign posted site access point and reverse in to work area. The bus stop at the intersection of Ferry/Isabella will be relocated approx.150m west on Ferry Rd for the duration of works. Initial works will be a shallow excavation for the installation of sheet piling for the trench. Excavations will proceed to the required depth, repairs will be undertaken, backfill of excavation, removal of sheet piling, then reinstatement of surface up to road level. (TMP 5a,5b) Once construction works have been completed, work site will revert back for the reinstatement of the raised island. (TMP 4a, 4b) This section repair is expected to take 40 days to complete. Upon completion of this section repair, works will shutdown for the holiday period, and resume on the 4th of January at the following location The final repair will be at the intersection of Ferry Rd and Manning Place. A contra flow with TSL and road closure of Manning Pl with east bound detour will be implemented for the duration of these works. Existing bus stops on the north and south sides of Ferry Rd will both be relocated 100m east on their respective sides. Initial works will be a shallow excavation for the installation of sheet piling for the trench. Excavations will proceed to the required depth, repairs will be undertaken, backfill of excavation, removal of sheet piling, then reinstatement of surface up to road level. (TMP 6a,6b,7) This section repair is expected to take 25 days to complete.

tns:item.tns:title: PRJ#11140 - Colombo St WW Replacement
tns:item.tns:address: Colombo St from Southampton St to #180 Colombo St
tns:item.tns:publicDescription: Works will start at the intersection Colombo St and Roxburgh St. Construction will proceed south along Colombo St and east along Roxburgh St, replacing the waste water main and laterals on the east side, ending at their respective termination points. Contra flow will then be switched to the western side, and replacement of laterals will be completed using pipe bursting. If pipe bursting is not viable, laterals have to be completed using open trenching, under MTC (possible nightworks) (SC Generics, TMP 1a, 1b, 2a, 2b, 3 and 6) Upon completion of construction and reinstatement south of Southey St, works will return to the Colombo/Southey intersection and proceed north. As before, waste water main and laterals will be replaced on the eastern side of Colombo St heading, across Roxburgh St intersection and north to the termination point just south of the Beaumont St intersection. As Roxburgh St is a cul-de-sac, road closure will be restricted to the hours between 7:30am and 6:00pm. Residents will be informed that they may not have access during these hours. Outside of these hours steel plates will be placed over any trenches and secured to allow residents access. (TMP 1a, 1b, 3, 4, & 6) As before, the contra flow will be switched to the western side of Colombo St, along with the road closure of Devon St and laterals will be completed through pipe bursting, if viable, otherwise they will be completed through open trenching under MTC (possible nightworks) (TMP 2a, 2b, 5 & 6)

tns:item.tns:title: PRJ#11185 - Fitzgerald Ave Water Valve
tns:item.tns:address: Fitzgerald Ave between Elm Grove and Leeds St
tns:item.tns:publicDescription: Works will begin in the section of Fitzgerald Ave between Gloucester St and Worcester St. Two valves will need to be installed between lanes 2 and 3 in the southbound lanes of Fitzgerald Ave. A right lane closure will be deployed north of Gloucester St, and then a 2 two lane chicane will divert traffic around the work area. Lane 1 traffic will be diverted in to the current parking lane, where lane width may be minimal. If needed, 500mm of the kerb/berm on the eastern side may be temporarily paved to maintain minimum lane widths, with barriers along the footpath to separate pedestrians and traffic. Spaces will be left for any access ways. Works along this section will take up to 2 weeks (TMP 1 and 1a) The second section is between St Asaph St and Leeds St. The same TTM as above will be employed, with a right lane closure north of St Asaph St, with a two lane closure around the work area. Again, as above, the kerb/berm may need to be temporarily paved to maintain lane widths, with barriers for pedestrian protection. This section of works will take up to 2 week. (TMP 2 and 2a)

tns:item.tns:address: - Ruru Rd - Kearneys Rd - Rudds Rd - Butterfield Ave - Buckleys Rd - Dacre Street - Sewell St - Kerrs Road - Pages Rd - Rudds Rd/ Coulter St - Mcgregors Rd - Buckleys Rd - Butterfield Ave - Dacre Street - Carnarvon Street - Sewell Street - Coulter Street - McGregors Rd - Glengyle Place - Rudds Rd - Woodham Rd - Griffiths Ave - McGregors Rd - Rudds Rd - Dacre Street - Kerrs Rd - Buckleys Rd - Rudds Rd - Nicholas Dr - Cypress St

tns:item.tns:title: SCIRT 11187 St Albans & Edgeware (WW)
tns:item.tns:address: Abberley Crescent Albany Street Barbadoes Street Bealey Avenue Berry Street Beverley Street Bishop Street Bristol Street Browns Road Caledonian Road Canon Street Champion Street Church Lane Clare Street Colombo Street Coles Place Cornwall Street Courtney Street Derby Street Devonport Lane Donald Place Dover Street Durham St North Durham Street Edgeware Road Eversleigh Street Geraldine Street Gordon Avenue Gresford Street Holly Street Kingsley Lane Kinloch Street Lindsay Street McDougall Avenue Madras Street Manchester Street Massey Crescent Merivale Lane Onslow Street Packe Street Papanui Road Purchas Street Ranfurly Street Rugby Street Sheppard Place Sherborne Street Springfield Road St Albans Street Stoneyhurst Street Trafalgar Street Webb Street
tns:item.tns:publicDescription: LOCATION: Abberley Crescent Albany Street Barbadoes Street Bealey Avenue Berry Street Beverley Street Bishop Street Bristol Street Browns Road Caledonian Road Canon Street Champion Street Church Lane Clare Street Colombo Street Coles Place Cornwall Street Courtney Street Derby Street Devonport Lane Donald Place Dover Street Durham St North Durham Street Edgeware Road Eversleigh Street Geraldine Street Gordon Avenue Gresford Street Holly Street Kingsley Lane Kinloch Street Lindsay Street McDougall Avenue Madras Street Manchester Street Massey Crescent Merivale Lane Onslow Street Packe Street Papanui Road Purchas Street Ranfurly Street Rugby Street Sheppard Place Sherborne Street Springfield Road St Albans Street Stoneyhurst Street Trafalgar Street Webb Street OPERATION: CIR: This project consists of the following operations in various locations within the Edgeware and St Albans Catchments The gravity wastewater main is the pipe that takes wastewater from private laterals through to the pump station. The existing gravity wastewater pipe has suffered multiple breaks due to the earthquakes and needs to be replaced. To complete the gravity wastewater renewal we need to dig trenches ranging from 1.1-2.5 metres deep. Dewatering, using spears and extraction pumping, will be required to drop the water table in the trenches at all times. Excavation will proceed once the ground is dry, using trench shields. A new PVC (polyvinyl chloride) pipe will be installed, then laterals will be renewed and attached at the private property boundary. There may need to be some excavation done at your boundary. After replacement of the waste water pipe the carriageway will be reinstated and sealed, road markings will be applied if applicable. Please note: CCTV and flushing of lines will be required prior to commencement of main works TRAFFIC MANAGEMENT: Road closures with detours Priority / Give Way Manual Traffic Control One Way systems Contraflows etc? COMMUNICATION: For further information please contact the Fletcher Construction Company - 0800 444 919
